intro: Hibbertia surcularis, commonly known as the spiral hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves around its stem. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. Hibbertia surcularis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and vibrant floral display.
